eu urges german regulator to step up telecoms competition -pipe- business -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 16.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 08.09.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de business -pipe- 16.06.2006 eu urges german regulator to step up telecoms competition großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : deutsche telekom is being targeted for unfair pricing by the eu the european commission has told germany that it must do more to shield consumers from high prices and bolster competition in the country 's fixed-line telecoms market , in which deutsche telekom has a 94 percent share . the commission said that the german telecoms regulator bundesnetzagentur should step up price controls to encourage greater competition and ensure consumers are protected from excessive prices charged by dominant operator deutsche telekom .
in a letter to the bundesnetzagentur , eu officials said telekom should be made to show exactly how it charges for calls , and if its prices are based on actual costs .
prices for telecommunications services are higher in germany than in most other eu countries .
commission spokesman martin selmayr told reporters that , with 94 percent of the fixed-line call market , deutsche telekom had " significant market power that needs to be regulated . "
" there is a problem of competition on the german fixed access market , " he said .
" the german telecoms regulator should use its powers under the eu telecom rules to impose efficient remedies on this market . "
suggested remedies fall short selmayr said that the eu information society and media commissioner viviane reding was not satisfied with the " remedies " put forward by the bundesnetzagentur so far .
last month , the regulator sent a proposal to brussels describing a plan to ask deutsche telekom to inform it of future prices .
" the commission does n't believe the proposal of remedies is sufficient , " he said .
" to achieve cost orientation we believe that … price regulation is necessary . "
bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : telekom 's planned new high-speed network has also come under fire the commission has also criticized deutsche telekom 's plans for a three-billion-euro -lrb- $ 3.56 billion -rrb- high-speed network , saying a new monopoly must not be created to replace the old and that the company must open up infrastructure to rivals .
as the eu recommendations are only " semi-binding , " germany is not required to fulfil them , but a national regulator must take " utmost account " of a request from brussels .
should the german regulator fail to implement brussels ' recommendations , germany could face breach of contract procedures based on eu telecoms legislation .
the procedure could lead to a lawsuit at the european court of justice .
according to the commission , other eu states including austria , ireland , the netherlands , and spain have already tackled a lack of competition in their retail phone markets . dw staff -lrb- dc -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de eu threatens legal action against germany over broadband germany appears determined to pass a new telecommunications law that critics say would give deutsche telekom a monopoly over broadband connections .
the eu has threatened legal action .
-lrb- may 18 , 2006 -rrb- eu threatens sanctions over protection request by telekom deutsche telekom wants to develop a faster dsl connection and says it needs protection from competitors to do so .
but the eu warned germany not to offer it .
-lrb- march 14 , 2006 -rrb- german government sells telekom stake to foreign " locust " the german state development bank kfw and the german government agreed monday to sell a 4.5 percent stake in deutsche telekom to us private equity firm blackstone for 2.68 billion euros -lrb- $ 3.3 billion -rrb- .
-lrb- april 24 , 2006 -rrb- feedback send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

live ticker : netherland 2:1 ivory coast -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 16.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 23.12.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 16.06.2006 live ticker : netherland 2:1 ivory coast review all the game 's action with the dw-world.de live ticker . a packed stadium in stuttgart will watch the contest .
the netherlands go through to the next round with a win .
ivory coast , meanwhile , are fighting for survival .
the netherlands start with : van der sar , heitinga , ooijer , mathijsen , van bronckhorst , van bommel , sneijder , cocu , van persie , van nistelrooy , robben ivory coast 's first eleven : tizie , eboue , k. toure , meite , boka , y. toure , zokora , romaric , a. kone , drogba , b. kone the referee is oscar ruiz from columbia .
1. min .
the match begins with the netherlands first on the ball .
3. min .
a cautious start by both sides , who know there 's a lot on the line .
5. min .
van histelrooy ca n't quite reach a van bommel cross directly in front of ivory coast 's goal .
7. min .
ivory coast 's defense looks a bit unsure , especially on long balls .
10. min .
little rhythm on display here , with lots of niggling fouls and misdirected passes .
12. min .
eboue hits the ground in the box , but ruiz says , play on .
15. min .
romaric tries one from long distance but no problem for van der sar .
16. min .
a. kone hits the side netting .
ivory coast with more of the ball now .
20. min .
the netherlands ' midfield is practically invisible , as the oranjes try their luck with long balls .
21. min .
goal for the netherlands ! ! ! ! !
van persie with an explosive free-kick from the edge of the box .
23. min .
zokoro booked , after van persie 's goal opens the match up .
26. min .
goal for the netherlands ! ! ! ! ! ! 2-nil .
van nistelrooy hits pay dirt after a lovely solo run by robben .
27. min .
no more lethargy here after a pair of goals for the netherlands .
ivory coast will have to do more .
31. min .
sloppy passing kills an incipient ivory coast attack .
32. min .
zokora hits the bar with a powerful blast from just outside the box .
33. min .
robben booked for diving .
replay shows there was contact .
34. min .
and yellow for mathijsen as well .
36. min .
what was a snoozer has developed nicely , with ivory coast trying to narrow the deficit .
37. min .
goal for ivory coast ! ! ! !
b. kone pushes the ball up the right and fires a rocket into the upper left-hand corner .
40. min .
drogba sees yellow after contact with van der sar .
drogba misses next match .
a bitter blow for ivory coast .
42. min .
drogba on the breakaway , but his pass to a. kone came too late .
44. min .
netherlands with a corner-kick but ivory coast clear easily .
45. min .
a. kone lifts a shot over the bar .
45. min . + 2 the netherlands lead 2-1 at half-time , but ivory coast are gaining momentum .
the second half should be a real corker .
46. min .
boulahrouz for heitinga 46. min .
the second half kicks off .
ivory coast have first possession .
47. min .
van persie with the half 's first shot on goal .
49. min .
k. toure with a long free-kick , but van der sar scoops it up .
49. min .
van der vaart replaces sneijder 50. min .
van nistelrooy tests tizie .
53. min .
eboue with a chance from 4 meters out but mathijsen blocks the shot .
54. min .
sloppy play in the netherlands ' midfield is giving ivory coast opportunities .
56. min .
yellow card for van bommel .
61. min .
yapi-yapo and didane for romaric and b. kone fresh legs for ivory coast 63. min .
dutch coach marco van basten exhorts his players to increase the tempo .
65. min .
boka is booked after tripping van persie from behind .
67. min .
netherlands will try to catch ivory coast on the counter-attack , while ivory coast need at least one more goal .
69. min .
robben fires from short range but tizie parries .
72. min .
landzaat for van nistelrooy akale for a. kone both teams with substitutions .
75. min .
the final fifteen minutes , with the result hanging on a knife 's edge .
76. min .
van persie clears on the line after an ivory coast corner .
that was close .
78. min .
the netherlands have withdrawn into their own half of the pitch .
81. min .
ivory coast in complete control of the ball but with problems penetrating the penalty area .
84. min .
robben counter-attacks but pulls his shot over the goal .
87. min .
ivory coast make little headway against the dutch defense .
88. min .
long ball to drogba rolls out of bounds .
90. min .
at the end of regulation time , ivory coast have the ball .
90. min .
three minutes injury time .
90. min . + 1 ivory coast corner-kick sails well over the box .
90. min .
cocu + 3 final free-kick for ivory coast comes to naught .
90. min .
netherlands win 2-1 ! + 4 the dutch are through to the next round , while ivory coast are out .
van persie was the best man for the oranjes , and bakary kone for ivory coast , in a close , close match . dw staff -lrb- cha -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic feedback send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

live ticker : argentina 6:0 serbia and montenegro -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 16.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 31.10.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 16.06.2006 live ticker : argentina 6:0 serbia and montenegro review all the action from the match with the dw-world.de live ticker . the next match on dw-world.de 's live ticker argentina play serbia & montenegro in the first of the second round of group c matches .
a sell-out crowd of 52,000 is on hand in gelsenkirchen to watch favored argentina take on serbia-montenegro .
argentina 's starting line-up abbondanzieri , burdisso , ayala , heinze , sorin , rodriguez , mascherano , gonzalez , riquelme , saviola , crespo .
serbia-montenegro 's starting eleven jevric , duljaj , gavrancic , krstajic , dragutinovic , nadj , koroman , p. djordjevic , stankovic , milosevic , kezman .
the atmosphere is tense for this group c match .
argentina would be virtually through with a win , while a loss would likely doom serbia-montenegro .
the referee is roberto rosetti from italy .
1. min .
and we 're underway .
argentina have first possession .
3. min .
argentina begin strongly with a dangerous corner-kick .
5. min .
goal for argentina !
maxi rodriguez receives a beautiful pass in the box and holds his nerve to put the gauchos up 1-nil .
7. min .
koroman misses next match .
koroman tries to counterattack for serbia-montenegro , but fouls his opponent instead .
9. min .
djordjevic pulls a shot wide right of the net .
13. min .
free-kick for argentina , but sorin fails to capitalize .
16. min .
argentina : cambiasso for gonzalez 18. min .
kezman pushes the ball up the left , but a milosevic foul negates a nice cross .
20. min .
serbia-montenegro with more of the ball now , as argentina shift down a gear .
24. min .
promising free-kick for the gauchos , but krstajic clears .
25. min .
crespo a second too late on the ensuing corner-kick .
26. min .
albert nadj for holding .
28. min .
argentina back in form now with riquelme missing an open shot on goal .
30. min .
goal ! ! ! !
argentina lead 2-nil .
cambiasso scores after a fabulous multi-pass combination involving half of the gauchos ' midfield .
34. min .
argentinean celebrations in the stands , despair on the pitch for serbia-montenegro .
36. min .
crespo for playing on after off-sides call that negated a goal .
poor crespo , the linesman looks to have gotten that one wrong .
41. min .
goal ! ! !
argentina 3-nil .
saviola presses into the box , rodriguez cleans up for his second goal of the match .
42. min .
krstajic , who looked poor on argentina 's third goal .
45. min .
a late corner-kick for serbia-montenegro yields only frustration .
45. min . + 2 argentina with a deserved 3-nil lead after one of the most convincing halves of the tournament .
serbia-montenegro have more than a mountain to climb .
46. min .
serbia-montenegro start off the second half needing a major , major miracle .
46. min .
ergic for nadj 46. min .
milosevic tests abbondanzieri .
49. min .
lluboja for koroman 50. min .
crespo tries to get on the score sheet with a 15 meter blast , but jevric holds .
53. min .
the gauchos are showing no mercy here .
but riquelme fails to convert a free-kick from close in .
54. min .
milosevic fails to latch onto a promising cross in the box .
57. min .
serbia-montenegro are n't giving up , but they 're not creating many chances , either .
58. min .
tevez gives saviola a well-deserved break .
61. min .
argentina now seem content to show off their considerable ball handling skills in midfield .
65. min .
kezman 's day is done after taking out his frustration on mascherano .
66. min .
the only question now : will argentina punish 10-man serbia-montenegro ? 69. min .
vukic for milosevic serbia-montenegro are in damage-control mode .
73. min .
crespo brought down in the box , but no whistle from rosetti .
74. min .
young gun messi for man of the match rodriguez 77. min .
rare corner for serbia-montenegro , but no luck there , either .
78. min .
goal for argentina !
messi feeds crespo to add insult to injury .
81. min .
one spectator , in particular , must be happy - argentinean soccer legend , diego maradona , who 's in the stadium .
83. min .
and he 's not the only one .
argentina 's fans celebrate their team with choruses of ole !
ole ! 84. min .
another one for the gauchos !
tevez dribbles through two defenders and slides the ball into the net .
87. min .
ouch !
messi puts argentina up 6-nil !
it 's the youngster 's first world cup goal .
90. min . + 1 rosetti takes pity on serbia-montenegro , who were ripped apart 6-nil by a ferocious argentina squad .
argentina looks sure to progress to the next round . dw staff -lrb- cha -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic feedback send us an e-mail .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 16.06.2006 live ticker : argentina 6:0 serbia and montenegro review all the action from the match with the dw-world.de live ticker . the next match on dw-world.de 's live ticker argentina play serbia & montenegro in the first of the second round of group c matches .
a sell-out crowd of 52,000 is on hand in gelsenkirchen to watch favored argentina take on serbia-montenegro .
argentina 's starting line-up abbondanzieri , burdisso , ayala , heinze , sorin , rodriguez , mascherano , gonzalez , riquelme , saviola , crespo .
serbia-montenegro 's starting eleven jevric , duljaj , gavrancic , krstajic , dragutinovic , nadj , koroman , p. djordjevic , stankovic , milosevic , kezman .
the atmosphere is tense for this group c match .
argentina would be virtually through with a win , while a loss would likely doom serbia-montenegro .
the referee is roberto rosetti from italy .
1. min .
and we 're underway .
argentina have first possession .
3. min .
argentina begin strongly with a dangerous corner-kick .
5. min .
goal for argentina !
maxi rodriguez receives a beautiful pass in the box and holds his nerve to put the gauchos up 1-nil .
7. min .
koroman misses next match .
koroman tries to counterattack for serbia-montenegro , but fouls his opponent instead .
9. min .
djordjevic pulls a shot wide right of the net .
13. min .
free-kick for argentina , but sorin fails to capitalize .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 16.06.2006 live ticker : netherland 2:1 ivory coast review all the game 's action with the dw-world.de live ticker . a packed stadium in stuttgart will watch the contest .
the netherlands go through to the next round with a win .
ivory coast , meanwhile , are fighting for survival .
the netherlands start with : van der sar , heitinga , ooijer , mathijsen , van bronckhorst , van bommel , sneijder , cocu , van persie , van nistelrooy , robben ivory coast 's first eleven : tizie , eboue , k. toure , meite , boka , y. toure , zokora , romaric , a. kone , drogba , b. kone the referee is oscar ruiz from columbia .
1. min .
the match begins with the netherlands first on the ball .
3. min .
a cautious start by both sides , who know there 's a lot on the line .
5. min .
van histelrooy ca n't quite reach a van bommel cross directly in front of ivory coast 's goal .
7. min .
ivory coast 's defense looks a bit unsure , especially on long balls .
10. min .
little rhythm on display here , with lots of niggling fouls and misdirected passes .
12. min .
eboue hits the ground in the box , but ruiz says , play on .
15. min .
romaric tries one from long distance but no problem for van der sar .
16. min .
a. kone hits the side netting .
ivory coast with more of the ball now .
20. min .
the netherlands ' midfield is practically invisible , as the oranjes try their luck with long balls .
21. min .
goal for the netherlands ! ! ! ! !
van persie with an explosive free-kick from the edge of the box .
23. min .
zokoro booked , after van persie 's goal opens the match up .
26. min .
goal for the netherlands ! ! ! ! ! ! 2-nil .
van nistelrooy hits pay dirt after a lovely solo run by robben .
27. min .
no more lethargy here after a pair of goals for the netherlands .
ivory coast will have to do more .
31. min .
sloppy passing kills an incipient ivory coast attack .
32. min .
zokora hits the bar with a powerful blast from just outside the box .
33. min .
robben booked for diving .
replay shows there was contact .
34. min .
and yellow for mathijsen as well .
36. min .
what was a snoozer has developed nicely , with ivory coast trying to narrow the deficit .
37. min .
goal for ivory coast ! ! ! !
b. kone pushes the ball up the right and fires a rocket into the upper left-hand corner .
40. min .
drogba sees yellow after contact with van der sar .
drogba misses next match .
a bitter blow for ivory coast .
42. min .
drogba on the breakaway , but his pass to a. kone came too late .
44. min .
netherlands with a corner-kick but ivory coast clear easily .
45. min .
a. kone lifts a shot over the bar .
45. min . + 2 the netherlands lead 2-1 at half-time , but ivory coast are gaining momentum .
the second half should be a real corker .
46. min .
boulahrouz for heitinga 46. min .
the second half kicks off .
ivory coast have first possession .
47. min .
van persie with the half 's first shot on goal .
49. min .
k. toure with a long free-kick , but van der sar scoops it up .
49. min .
van der vaart replaces sneijder 50. min .
van nistelrooy tests tizie .
53. min .
eboue with a chance from 4 meters out but mathijsen blocks the shot .
54. min .
sloppy play in the netherlands ' midfield is giving ivory coast opportunities .
56. min .
yellow card for van bommel .
61. min .
yapi-yapo and didane for romaric and b. kone fresh legs for ivory coast 63. min .
dutch coach marco van basten exhorts his players to increase the tempo .
65. min .
boka is booked after tripping van persie from behind .
67. min .
netherlands will try to catch ivory coast on the counter-attack , while ivory coast need at least one more goal .
69. min .
robben fires from short range but tizie parries .
72. min .
landzaat for van nistelrooy akale for a. kone both teams with substitutions .
75. min .
the final fifteen minutes , with the result hanging on a knife 's edge .
76. min .
van persie clears on the line after an ivory coast corner .
that was close .
78. min .
the netherlands have withdrawn into their own half of the pitch .
81. min .
ivory coast in complete control of the ball but with problems penetrating the penalty area .
84. min .
robben counter-attacks but pulls his shot over the goal .
87. min .
ivory coast make little headway against the dutch defense .
88. min .
long ball to drogba rolls out of bounds .
90. min .
at the end of regulation time , ivory coast have the ball .
90. min .
three minutes injury time .
90. min . + 1 ivory coast corner-kick sails well over the box .
90. min .
cocu + 3 final free-kick for ivory coast comes to naught .
90. min .
netherlands win 2-1 ! + 4 the dutch are through to the next round , while ivory coast are out .
van persie was the best man for the oranjes , and bakary kone for ivory coast , in a close , close match . dw staff -lrb- cha -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic 9801 picture gallery daily highlights from the world cup the world cup in pictures a nation expects dw-world.de presents germany 's 2006 world cup squad .

argentina beat up serbia and montenegro -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 16.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 22.06.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 16.06.2006 argentina beat up serbia and montenegro großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the argentinean players could start their celebration long before the end of the match argentina proved why some consider them a world cup title contender , displaying their speed and precision passing in a 6-0 rout of their group c opponents . fuelled by a more offensive display than against ivory coast , the argentineans ripped the beleaguered serbs to shreds after responding to coach jose pekerman 's call for more control of the game . as the south american 's main playmaker juan roman riquelme received the close man-to-man attention of albert nadj , it was up to the rest of the side to inject their creativity into the match . the argentines did just that with their first solid goal chance in front of the serbia montenegro goal six minutes into the match when maxi rodriguez slid a pass into the penalty area from javier saviola past dragoslav jevric and tallied his first of two goals on the day . in 31st minute , saviola , who claimed man of the match honors for repeatedly tearing through defenders , and juan riquelme combined in a fluid cross field movement from the left that found right wing esteban cambiasso on the edge of the penalty area . the midfielder scored on a left-footed volley after a glorious one-two with crespo , who fed cambiasso with a back-heeled pass . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : argentina 's gabriel heinze , center , was a bit ahead for the whole game gonzalez made it three just before half time , after saviola poached the ball from a serb player near the corner post and ran around the defense to feed hernan crespo with a low cross . the chelsea striker was deprived by a gaggle of serb defenders and goalkeeper but the ball ran across to gonzalez , who side footed his shot off the post for argentina 's third . argentine keeper left with nothing to do serbia-montenegro 's strikers were largely denied by argentina 's well organized defense , backed by a confident abbondanzieri in goal and appeared demoralized by half time . the serbs struggled to contain the argentinean tide at the back despite the slower pace of the game , showed little creativity and appeared blunted in the second half . in his first world cup appearance , 18-year-old lionel messi was fouled on virtually his first touch of the ball after coming on in the 75th minute .
the youngster latched on to the swiftly taken free kick to feed crespo with an inch-perfect cross to crespo for argentina 's fifth carlos tevez , who replaced saviola midway through the second half , dribbled past two defenders and curled his shot past jevric , while messi , hailed as maradona 's heir , marked his return from injury with his first world cup goal in only 15 minutes on the pitch . dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de weakened serbia & montenegro ripe for argentinean plucking two-time world cup winners argentina , buoyed by three points from their first game against ivory coast , on friday take on a serbia-montenegro side severely weakened by the loss of defensive pillar nemanja vidic .
-lrb- june 16 , 2006 -rrb- argentina beat battling ivory coast in group c classic the ivory coast put up a brave fight against argentina , one of the world cup favorites , and showed more evidence that one day the tournament will have a champion from the african continent .
-lrb- june 11 , 2006 -rrb- live ticker : argentina 6:0 serbia and montenegro reveiw all the details from the match with the dw-world.de live ticker .

argentina beat up serbia and montenegro großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the argentinean players could start their celebration long before the end of the match argentina proved why some consider them a world cup title contender , displaying their speed and precision passing in a 6-0 rout of their group c opponents . fuelled by a more offensive display than against ivory coast , the argentineans ripped the beleaguered serbs to shreds after responding to coach jose pekerman 's call for more control of the game . as the south american 's main playmaker juan roman riquelme received the close man-to-man attention of albert nadj , it was up to the rest of the side to inject their creativity into the match . the argentines did just that with their first solid goal chance in front of the serbia montenegro goal six minutes into the match when maxi rodriguez slid a pass into the penalty area from javier saviola past dragoslav jevric and tallied his first of two goals on the day . in 31st minute , saviola , who claimed man of the match honors for repeatedly tearing through defenders , and juan riquelme combined in a fluid cross field movement from the left that found right wing esteban cambiasso on the edge of the penalty area . the midfielder scored on a left-footed volley after a glorious one-two with crespo , who fed cambiasso with a back-heeled pass . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : argentina 's gabriel heinze , center , was a bit ahead for the whole game gonzalez made it three just before half time , after saviola poached the ball from a serb player near the corner post and ran around the defense to feed hernan crespo with a low cross . the chelsea striker was deprived by a gaggle of serb defenders and goalkeeper but the ball ran across to gonzalez , who side footed his shot off the post for argentina 's third . argentine keeper left with nothing to do serbia-montenegro 's strikers were largely denied by argentina 's well organized defense , backed by a confident abbondanzieri in goal and appeared demoralized by half time . the serbs struggled to contain the argentinean tide at the back despite the slower pace of the game , showed little creativity and appeared blunted in the second half . in his first world cup appearance , 18-year-old lionel messi was fouled on virtually his first touch of the ball after coming on in the 75th minute .
the youngster latched on to the swiftly taken free kick to feed crespo with an inch-perfect cross to crespo for argentina 's fifth carlos tevez , who replaced saviola midway through the second half , dribbled past two defenders and curled his shot past jevric , while messi , hailed as maradona 's heir , marked his return from injury with his first world cup goal in only 15 minutes on the pitch . dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de weakened serbia & montenegro ripe for argentinean plucking two-time world cup winners argentina , buoyed by three points from their first game against ivory coast , on friday take on a serbia-montenegro side severely weakened by the loss of defensive pillar nemanja vidic .
-lrb- june 16 , 2006 -rrb- argentina beat battling ivory coast in group c classic the ivory coast put up a brave fight against argentina , one of the world cup favorites , and showed more evidence that one day the tournament will have a champion from the african continent .
-lrb- june 11 , 2006 -rrb- live ticker : argentina 6:0 serbia and montenegro reveiw all the details from the match with the dw-world.de live ticker .

argentina beat up serbia and montenegro -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 16.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 22.12.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 16.06.2006 argentina beat up serbia and montenegro großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the argentinean players could start their celebration long before the end of the match argentina proved why some consider them a world cup title contender , displaying their speed and precision passing in a 6-0 rout of their group c opponents . fuelled by a more offensive display than against ivory coast , the argentineans ripped the beleaguered serbs to shreds after responding to coach jose pekerman 's call for more control of the game . as the south american 's main playmaker juan roman riquelme received the close man-to-man attention of albert nadj , it was up to the rest of the side to inject their creativity into the match . the argentines did just that with their first solid goal chance in front of the serbia montenegro goal six minutes into the match when maxi rodriguez slid a pass into the penalty area from javier saviola past dragoslav jevric and tallied his first of two goals on the day . in 31st minute , saviola , who claimed man of the match honors for repeatedly tearing through defenders , and juan riquelme combined in a fluid cross field movement from the left that found right wing esteban cambiasso on the edge of the penalty area . the midfielder scored on a left-footed volley after a glorious one-two with crespo , who fed cambiasso with a back-heeled pass . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : argentina 's gabriel heinze , center , was a bit ahead for the whole game gonzalez made it three just before half time , after saviola poached the ball from a serb player near the corner post and ran around the defense to feed hernan crespo with a low cross . the chelsea striker was deprived by a gaggle of serb defenders and goalkeeper but the ball ran across to gonzalez , who side footed his shot off the post for argentina 's third . argentine keeper left with nothing to do serbia-montenegro 's strikers were largely denied by argentina 's well organized defense , backed by a confident abbondanzieri in goal and appeared demoralized by half time . the serbs struggled to contain the argentinean tide at the back despite the slower pace of the game , showed little creativity and appeared blunted in the second half . in his first world cup appearance , 18-year-old lionel messi was fouled on virtually his first touch of the ball after coming on in the 75th minute .
the youngster latched on to the swiftly taken free kick to feed crespo with an inch-perfect cross to crespo for argentina 's fifth carlos tevez , who replaced saviola midway through the second half , dribbled past two defenders and curled his shot past jevric , while messi , hailed as maradona 's heir , marked his return from injury with his first world cup goal in only 15 minutes on the pitch . dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de weakened serbia & montenegro ripe for argentinean plucking two-time world cup winners argentina , buoyed by three points from their first game against ivory coast , on friday take on a serbia-montenegro side severely weakened by the loss of defensive pillar nemanja vidic .
-lrb- june 16 , 2006 -rrb- argentina beat battling ivory coast in group c classic the ivory coast put up a brave fight against argentina , one of the world cup favorites , and showed more evidence that one day the tournament will have a champion from the african continent .
-lrb- june 11 , 2006 -rrb- live ticker : argentina 6:0 serbia and montenegro reveiw all the details from the match with the dw-world.de live ticker .
feedback what did you think argentina 's chances are of winning the cup ?
send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

world cup tourists make berlin richer - literally -pipe- business -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 16.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 24.06.2011 home news germany europe world asia business 125 years automobile science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de business -pipe- 16.06.2006 world cup tourists make berlin richer - literally großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : berliners have every reason to be happy about the world cup berlin is the german city that 's profiting most economically from the crowds of foreign world cup tourists descending on the country .
aside from watching games , some visitors are spending a fortune . for the cash-strapped german capital , the soccer world cup is a real boon .
with 500,000 new arrivals in the city every day , berlin boasts more visitors than any other city that 's hosting the soccer matches . of the half a million visitors here per day , no fewer than 200,000 stay in hotels and bed-and-breakfast places .
many shops in downtown berlin are registering record turnovers with soccer-related souvenirs selling like hot cakes . " all the guests from foreign countries visiting germany are coming in this shop , " said one street vendor near the brandenburg gate .
" it 's not the german people , it 's just outside people that come in here and they are especially interested in souvenirs for the world championship . " tricky exchange rates bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : australian fans may look funny , but they 're bringing much-needed cash to germany an australian tourist nearby , who had accompanied his team to their first world cup in 32 years , was just about to get a feel of the city and find his way around . " i 'm just going around , seeing the sites and eating the wonderful german food , " he said , adding that he is certain that at the end of his stay in berlin his pockets will be much emptier as he only gets about 50 euro cents -lrb- 60 us cents -rrb- for one australian dollar . " we have to be careful with what we spend , " he said .
" but the prices here do seem to be quite reasonable .
so even with the exchange rate it 's always on par with what i would spend in australia . " 50 million euros per day according to the latest statistics , the ordinary berlin visitor during the world cup spends about 180 euros on average , hotel costs included .
this means that berlin collects some 50 million euros from tourists every day . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : some swedes are roughing it , but they do love german beer the swedish tourists , for example , who were in town for thursday 's match pitting their team against paraguay , were certainly willing to add to the windfall .
but how much money were they willing to spend here ? two hundreds euros , said one man , who was echoed by a female fan . " if we win , we 'll spend more , " said another , adding that he could fork out up to 400 euros .
" and we will win . " lots of beer and sausages bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the so-called fan mile in front of the brandenburg gate business has been particularly brisk on berlin 's so-called " fan mile " - a two-kilometer-long -lrb- 1.2 miles -rrb- stretch for soccer buffs in the city center that starts right behind the brandenburg gate . the mile boasts several public viewing areas , with street vendors flanking the street .
among other things , they 've already sold one and a half million liters of beer and one and half million german sausages . hardy graupner -lrb- win -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de forget the title - germany wants an economic boom germany 's influential diw economic research institute released a forecast that the world cup would not significantly aid the country 's economy .
yet portugal 's experience in 2004 was slightly different .
-lrb- may 21 , 2006 -rrb- germany launches world cup charm offensive germans are not exactly known as a nation of charmers , but the world cup mania may change all that .
a national friendliness campaign is pumping millions into putting the smile on every german face .
-lrb- march 8 , 2006 -rrb- and the winner is … german tourism with a million foreign visitors expected for the 2006 world cup soccer games , and another 40 million television viewers globally , the german tourism industry is eager to promote curry sausages and the cologne cathedral .
-lrb- march 12 , 2006 -rrb- 9801 radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour .
european business week listen to the latest edition of european business week media center watch and listen explore new content daily in dw 's multimedia archive .

if you are inside the united states , it is still possible for you to enjoy dw-tv .
for more information , please click here .

flying the german flag - costly voyages for shipping companies captains in the classroom - rostock 's maritime school organbuilding - the art and craft of the perfect sound saving makes cents – new heating technology for industry © dw 2011 deutsche welle is not responsible for the content of external websites .

aside from watching games , some visitors are spending a fortune . for the cash-strapped german capital , the soccer world cup is a real boon .
with 500,000 new arrivals in the city every day , berlin boasts more visitors than any other city that 's hosting the soccer matches . of the half a million visitors here per day , no fewer than 200,000 stay in hotels and bed-and-breakfast places .
many shops in downtown berlin are registering record turnovers with soccer-related souvenirs selling like hot cakes . " all the guests from foreign countries visiting germany are coming in this shop , " said one street vendor near the brandenburg gate .
" it 's not the german people , it 's just outside people that come in here and they are especially interested in souvenirs for the world championship . " tricky exchange rates bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : australian fans may look funny , but they 're bringing much-needed cash to germany an australian tourist nearby , who had accompanied his team to their first world cup in 32 years , was just about to get a feel of the city and find his way around . " i 'm just going around , seeing the sites and eating the wonderful german food , " he said , adding that he is certain that at the end of his stay in berlin his pockets will be much emptier as he only gets about 50 euro cents -lrb- 60 us cents -rrb- for one australian dollar . " we have to be careful with what we spend , " he said .
" but the prices here do seem to be quite reasonable .
so even with the exchange rate it 's always on par with what i would spend in australia . " 50 million euros per day according to the latest statistics , the ordinary berlin visitor during the world cup spends about 180 euros on average , hotel costs included .
this means that berlin collects some 50 million euros from tourists every day . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : some swedes are roughing it , but they do love german beer the swedish tourists , for example , who were in town for thursday 's match pitting their team against paraguay , were certainly willing to add to the windfall .
but how much money were they willing to spend here ? two hundreds euros , said one man , who was echoed by a female fan . " if we win , we 'll spend more , " said another , adding that he could fork out up to 400 euros .
" and we will win . " lots of beer and sausages bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the so-called fan mile in front of the brandenburg gate business has been particularly brisk on berlin 's so-called " fan mile " - a two-kilometer-long -lrb- 1.2 miles -rrb- stretch for soccer buffs in the city center that starts right behind the brandenburg gate . the mile boasts several public viewing areas , with street vendors flanking the street .
among other things , they 've already sold one and a half million liters of beer and one and half million german sausages . hardy graupner -lrb- win -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de forget the title - germany wants an economic boom germany 's influential diw economic research institute released a forecast that the world cup would not significantly aid the country 's economy .
yet portugal 's experience in 2004 was slightly different .
-lrb- may 21 , 2006 -rrb- germany launches world cup charm offensive germans are not exactly known as a nation of charmers , but the world cup mania may change all that .
a national friendliness campaign is pumping millions into putting the smile on every german face .
-lrb- march 8 , 2006 -rrb- and the winner is … german tourism with a million foreign visitors expected for the 2006 world cup soccer games , and another 40 million television viewers globally , the german tourism industry is eager to promote curry sausages and the cologne cathedral .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de business -pipe- 16.06.2006 world cup tourists make berlin richer - literally großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : berliners have every reason to be happy about the world cup berlin is the german city that 's profiting most economically from the crowds of foreign world cup tourists descending on the country .
aside from watching games , some visitors are spending a fortune . for the cash-strapped german capital , the soccer world cup is a real boon .
with 500,000 new arrivals in the city every day , berlin boasts more visitors than any other city that 's hosting the soccer matches . of the half a million visitors here per day , no fewer than 200,000 stay in hotels and bed-and-breakfast places .
many shops in downtown berlin are registering record turnovers with soccer-related souvenirs selling like hot cakes . " all the guests from foreign countries visiting germany are coming in this shop , " said one street vendor near the brandenburg gate .
" it 's not the german people , it 's just outside people that come in here and they are especially interested in souvenirs for the world championship . " tricky exchange rates bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : australian fans may look funny , but they 're bringing much-needed cash to germany an australian tourist nearby , who had accompanied his team to their first world cup in 32 years , was just about to get a feel of the city and find his way around . " i 'm just going around , seeing the sites and eating the wonderful german food , " he said , adding that he is certain that at the end of his stay in berlin his pockets will be much emptier as he only gets about 50 euro cents -lrb- 60 us cents -rrb- for one australian dollar . " we have to be careful with what we spend , " he said .
" but the prices here do seem to be quite reasonable .
so even with the exchange rate it 's always on par with what i would spend in australia . " 50 million euros per day according to the latest statistics , the ordinary berlin visitor during the world cup spends about 180 euros on average , hotel costs included .
this means that berlin collects some 50 million euros from tourists every day . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : some swedes are roughing it , but they do love german beer the swedish tourists , for example , who were in town for thursday 's match pitting their team against paraguay , were certainly willing to add to the windfall .
but how much money were they willing to spend here ? two hundreds euros , said one man , who was echoed by a female fan . " if we win , we 'll spend more , " said another , adding that he could fork out up to 400 euros .
" and we will win . " lots of beer and sausages bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the so-called fan mile in front of the brandenburg gate business has been particularly brisk on berlin 's so-called " fan mile " - a two-kilometer-long -lrb- 1.2 miles -rrb- stretch for soccer buffs in the city center that starts right behind the brandenburg gate . the mile boasts several public viewing areas , with street vendors flanking the street .
among other things , they 've already sold one and a half million liters of beer and one and half million german sausages . hardy graupner -lrb- win -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de forget the title - germany wants an economic boom germany 's influential diw economic research institute released a forecast that the world cup would not significantly aid the country 's economy .
yet portugal 's experience in 2004 was slightly different .
-lrb- may 21 , 2006 -rrb- germany launches world cup charm offensive germans are not exactly known as a nation of charmers , but the world cup mania may change all that .
a national friendliness campaign is pumping millions into putting the smile on every german face .
-lrb- march 8 , 2006 -rrb- and the winner is … german tourism with a million foreign visitors expected for the 2006 world cup soccer games , and another 40 million television viewers globally , the german tourism industry is eager to promote curry sausages and the cologne cathedral .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de business -pipe- 16.06.2006 world cup tourists make berlin richer - literally großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : berliners have every reason to be happy about the world cup berlin is the german city that 's profiting most economically from the crowds of foreign world cup tourists descending on the country .
aside from watching games , some visitors are spending a fortune . for the cash-strapped german capital , the soccer world cup is a real boon .
with 500,000 new arrivals in the city every day , berlin boasts more visitors than any other city that 's hosting the soccer matches . of the half a million visitors here per day , no fewer than 200,000 stay in hotels and bed-and-breakfast places .
many shops in downtown berlin are registering record turnovers with soccer-related souvenirs selling like hot cakes . " all the guests from foreign countries visiting germany are coming in this shop , " said one street vendor near the brandenburg gate .
" it 's not the german people , it 's just outside people that come in here and they are especially interested in souvenirs for the world championship . " tricky exchange rates bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : australian fans may look funny , but they 're bringing much-needed cash to germany an australian tourist nearby , who had accompanied his team to their first world cup in 32 years , was just about to get a feel of the city and find his way around . " i 'm just going around , seeing the sites and eating the wonderful german food , " he said , adding that he is certain that at the end of his stay in berlin his pockets will be much emptier as he only gets about 50 euro cents -lrb- 60 us cents -rrb- for one australian dollar . " we have to be careful with what we spend , " he said .
" but the prices here do seem to be quite reasonable .
so even with the exchange rate it 's always on par with what i would spend in australia . " 50 million euros per day according to the latest statistics , the ordinary berlin visitor during the world cup spends about 180 euros on average , hotel costs included .
this means that berlin collects some 50 million euros from tourists every day . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : some swedes are roughing it , but they do love german beer the swedish tourists , for example , who were in town for thursday 's match pitting their team against paraguay , were certainly willing to add to the windfall .
but how much money were they willing to spend here ? two hundreds euros , said one man , who was echoed by a female fan . " if we win , we 'll spend more , " said another , adding that he could fork out up to 400 euros .
" and we will win . " lots of beer and sausages bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the so-called fan mile in front of the brandenburg gate business has been particularly brisk on berlin 's so-called " fan mile " - a two-kilometer-long -lrb- 1.2 miles -rrb- stretch for soccer buffs in the city center that starts right behind the brandenburg gate . the mile boasts several public viewing areas , with street vendors flanking the street .
among other things , they 've already sold one and a half million liters of beer and one and half million german sausages . hardy graupner -lrb- win -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de forget the title - germany wants an economic boom germany 's influential diw economic research institute released a forecast that the world cup would not significantly aid the country 's economy .
yet portugal 's experience in 2004 was slightly different .
-lrb- may 21 , 2006 -rrb- germany launches world cup charm offensive germans are not exactly known as a nation of charmers , but the world cup mania may change all that .
a national friendliness campaign is pumping millions into putting the smile on every german face .
-lrb- march 8 , 2006 -rrb- and the winner is … german tourism with a million foreign visitors expected for the 2006 world cup soccer games , and another 40 million television viewers globally , the german tourism industry is eager to promote curry sausages and the cologne cathedral .
-lrb- march 12 , 2006 -rrb- feedback are you in germany for the world cup ?
how much money have you been spending ?
please include your name and country in your reply .

world cup tourists make berlin richer - literally -pipe- business -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 16.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 27.01.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de business -pipe- 16.06.2006 world cup tourists make berlin richer - literally großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : berliners have every reason to be happy about the world cup berlin is the german city that 's profiting most economically from the crowds of foreign world cup tourists descending on the country .
aside from watching games , some visitors are spending a fortune . for the cash-strapped german capital , the soccer world cup is a real boon .
with 500,000 new arrivals in the city every day , berlin boasts more visitors than any other city that 's hosting the soccer matches . of the half a million visitors here per day , no fewer than 200,000 stay in hotels and bed-and-breakfast places .
many shops in downtown berlin are registering record turnovers with soccer-related souvenirs selling like hot cakes . " all the guests from foreign countries visiting germany are coming in this shop , " said one street vendor near the brandenburg gate .
" it 's not the german people , it 's just outside people that come in here and they are especially interested in souvenirs for the world championship . " tricky exchange rates bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : australian fans may look funny , but they 're bringing much-needed cash to germany an australian tourist nearby , who had accompanied his team to their first world cup in 32 years , was just about to get a feel of the city and find his way around . " i 'm just going around , seeing the sites and eating the wonderful german food , " he said , adding that he is certain that at the end of his stay in berlin his pockets will be much emptier as he only gets about 50 euro cents -lrb- 60 us cents -rrb- for one australian dollar . " we have to be careful with what we spend , " he said .
" but the prices here do seem to be quite reasonable .
so even with the exchange rate it 's always on par with what i would spend in australia . " 50 million euros per day according to the latest statistics , the ordinary berlin visitor during the world cup spends about 180 euros on average , hotel costs included .
this means that berlin collects some 50 million euros from tourists every day . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : some swedes are roughing it , but they do love german beer the swedish tourists , for example , who were in town for thursday 's match pitting their team against paraguay , were certainly willing to add to the windfall .
but how much money were they willing to spend here ? two hundreds euros , said one man , who was echoed by a female fan . " if we win , we 'll spend more , " said another , adding that he could fork out up to 400 euros .
" and we will win . " lots of beer and sausages bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the so-called fan mile in front of the brandenburg gate business has been particularly brisk on berlin 's so-called " fan mile " - a two-kilometer-long -lrb- 1.2 miles -rrb- stretch for soccer buffs in the city center that starts right behind the brandenburg gate . the mile boasts several public viewing areas , with street vendors flanking the street .
among other things , they 've already sold one and a half million liters of beer and one and half million german sausages . hardy graupner -lrb- win -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de forget the title - germany wants an economic boom germany 's influential diw economic research institute released a forecast that the world cup would not significantly aid the country 's economy .
yet portugal 's experience in 2004 was slightly different .
-lrb- may 21 , 2006 -rrb- germany launches world cup charm offensive germans are not exactly known as a nation of charmers , but the world cup mania may change all that .
a national friendliness campaign is pumping millions into putting the smile on every german face .
-lrb- march 8 , 2006 -rrb- and the winner is … german tourism with a million foreign visitors expected for the 2006 world cup soccer games , and another 40 million television viewers globally , the german tourism industry is eager to promote curry sausages and the cologne cathedral .
-lrb- march 12 , 2006 -rrb- feedback are you in germany for the world cup ?
how much money have you been spending ?
please include your name and country in your reply .

young stars win plaudits as new german generation shines -pipe- features -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 16.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 27.09.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de features -pipe- 16.06.2006 young stars win plaudits as new german generation shines großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : david odonkor -lrb- l . -rrb- and oliver neuville celebrate after the winning goal germany 's last gasp win over poland , which has booked the team a berth in the knock-out stage , was engineered by a crop of young talent , vindicating coach jürgen klinsmann 's reformist zeal . when jürgen klinsmann was still around as a player - not the 1990 world cup-winning incarnation but the striker who was part of an aging 1998 squad which earned infamy back home for a quarter-final loss to croatia - the talk was of a german team of has-beens . not any more .
under the reforming guidance of the former stuttgart , inter milan , tottenham and bayern munich star , there has been a generational shift in the german squad . the going has n't been easy .
teething troubles included a disastrous 4-1 loss earlier this year to italy , which saw abuse heaped on the side amid acrimonious media claims that a california-based klinsmann was possibly not the man to bring the world cup home after a 16-year void . critics silenced by victory but klinsmann 's decision to field youngsters such as per mertesacker , david odonkor and lukas podolski has been vindicated by the team 's two group wins in the world cup so far , which have galvanized an entire nation .
suddenly , the fans believe in the team again and , increasingly , so do the players . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : klinsmann has been under fire in germany in the past germany 's media - and in particular the mass-selling tabloid bild - which have launched savage attacks on klinsmann and his tactics in the past , suddenly seemed to change their tune after the team 's impressive performance in the tournament . " klinsi 's already jubilating like a world champion again , " bild headlined , while others commented that the win had silenced even the most persistent of critics . " overpowering emotion " odonkor was still taking in his dream of appearing in the world cup on his dortmund home turf as a substitute in the win over poland , which essentially ensured entry into the last 16 .
it was a dipping cross by odonkor that allowed another substitute , striker oliver neuville , to slide in and convert it into a goal in the dying minutes of the game . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : an ecstatic oliver neuville after he scored the goal against poland " when the goal went in i just did n't know where to run - the emotion of the moment was overpowering , " said the 22-year-old whose father is ghanaian and whose mother is german . the attacking midfielder was a surprise call-up into the german squad and saw his development hampered by a serious knee injury after making his bundesliga debut in 2002 . odonkor says the atmosphere at the world cup in the german camp could not be better and the young players are being well looked after . " the whole team have taken me under their wing - it 's really like a family , " odonkor said thursday at the german team 's berlin media headquarters .
" my family came -lrb- to the poland game -rrb- .
it was so important to me they were in the stadium . " germans quietly confident the germans looked rocky at the back in conceding two goals against plucky costa rica , but odonkor and mertesacker insisted the problems had largely been ironed out after the squad sat down and analyzed where they were going wrong in defense . " we showed we are a good team and we can be proud of our performance , " odonkor said , echoing klinsmann 's assessment after the final whistle . mertesacker , of hannover 96 , who already has 25 caps to his name at 21 as a cultured defender , has kept his place since a 2004 debut win over iran , holding off claims to bring back one of the veterans of 1998 , christian worns . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : mertesacker -lrb- r . -rrb- fights for the ball with poland 's ebi smolarek he said thursday that the germans were feeling quietly confident after their winning showings . " we went over the first game with a fine tooth comb .
we decided what needed fixing and worked to iron out those weak points which had emerged in defense . " with klinsmann having fielded a clutch of other young stars , such as lukas podolski of cologne and bayern 's bastian schweinsteiger , the future , at least in the mid-term , is suddenly looking quite bright for the hosts .
but it is asking a lot of them to conquer the world in the next three weeks . " it 's a steep learning curve - many people laughed when i was first called up after just 20 league games .
things are going very quickly , " said mertesacker . klinsmann has said that critics had been too hasty in criticizing the team line-up . " some did n't know how to assess the strengths -lrb- of the team -rrb- , " klinsmann said .
" we did n't have any qualification games and some positive and negative results .
but we knew that the real test would come at the world cup .
we believe in this team . " " we can play even better " separately , england and ecuador too qualified for the knock-out stage on thursday , while sweden boosted their chances of joining them in the last 16 with a late win over paraguay . " we have now seen everyone and we have n't really seen anyone we ca n't deal with , " team assistant and euro-96 champion oliver bierhoff said as he looked forward to a likely second-round meeting with england or sweden . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german manager bierhoff says germany would rather play sweden than england -lrb- here in top form -rrb- " i think i could live better with the winner of sweden versus paraguay , " conceded the man who helped knock england out in the euro-96 semi-finals . whatever the group situation , there is unlikely to be any let-up in the furious pace the hosts have shown at the start of their bid for a fourth world cup triumph . " it was unbelievable to see us score in the final minute , " winger bastian schweinsteiger told reporters .
" i think we can play even better , and we 'll try and prove it in the next game . " dw staff -lrb- sp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de neuville 's last gasp goal breaks polish hearts substitute oliver neuville scored a stoppage time winner as host nation germany moved to the brink of qualifying for the second round of the world cup with a 1-0 win over poland in dortmund on wednesday .
-lrb- june 15 , 2006 -rrb- germany 's strikers eye crunch game with mixed emotions germany 's clash against poland wednesday is set to be an emotional rollercoaster for striker duo miroslav kose and lukas podolski .
both were born in poland , speak polish and want to play particularly well - for germany .
-lrb- june 14 , 2006 -rrb- precocious talents wait to explode at kindergarten cup the world cup will see a number of players emerge who , if it were n't for their prodigious skill with a ball , would probably still be studying for school exams .
-lrb- may 26 , 2006 -rrb- feedback do you think an infusion of young talent in national teams is a good idea ?
send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply 9801 picture gallery daily highlights from the world cup the world cup in pictures interviews the stars have their say world cup stars talk to dw-world.de about the tournament .

argentina beat up serbia and montenegro -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 16.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 01.10.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 16.06.2006 argentina beat up serbia and montenegro großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the argentinean players could start their celebration long before the end of the match argentina proved why some consider them a world cup title contender , displaying their speed and precision passing in a 6-0 rout of their group c opponents . fuelled by a more offensive display than against ivory coast , the argentineans ripped the beleaguered serbs to shreds after responding to coach jose pekerman 's call for more control of the game . as the south american 's main playmaker juan roman riquelme received the close man-to-man attention of albert nadj , it was up to the rest of the side to inject their creativity into the match . the argentines did just that with their first solid goal chance in front of the serbia montenegro goal six minutes into the match when maxi rodriguez slid a pass into the penalty area from javier saviola past dragoslav jevric and tallied his first of two goals on the day . in 31st minute , saviola , who claimed man of the match honors for repeatedly tearing through defenders , and juan riquelme combined in a fluid cross field movement from the left that found right wing esteban cambiasso on the edge of the penalty area . the midfielder scored on a left-footed volley after a glorious one-two with crespo , who fed cambiasso with a back-heeled pass . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : argentina 's gabriel heinze , center , was a bit ahead for the whole game gonzalez made it three just before half time , after saviola poached the ball from a serb player near the corner post and ran around the defense to feed hernan crespo with a low cross . the chelsea striker was deprived by a gaggle of serb defenders and goalkeeper but the ball ran across to gonzalez , who side footed his shot off the post for argentina 's third . argentine keeper left with nothing to do serbia-montenegro 's strikers were largely denied by argentina 's well organized defense , backed by a confident abbondanzieri in goal and appeared demoralized by half time . the serbs struggled to contain the argentinean tide at the back despite the slower pace of the game , showed little creativity and appeared blunted in the second half . in his first world cup appearance , 18-year-old lionel messi was fouled on virtually his first touch of the ball after coming on in the 75th minute .
the youngster latched on to the swiftly taken free kick to feed crespo with an inch-perfect cross to crespo for argentina 's fifth carlos tevez , who replaced saviola midway through the second half , dribbled past two defenders and curled his shot past jevric , while messi , hailed as maradona 's heir , marked his return from injury with his first world cup goal in only 15 minutes on the pitch . dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de weakened serbia & montenegro ripe for argentinean plucking two-time world cup winners argentina , buoyed by three points from their first game against ivory coast , on friday take on a serbia-montenegro side severely weakened by the loss of defensive pillar nemanja vidic .
-lrb- june 16 , 2006 -rrb- argentina beat battling ivory coast in group c classic the ivory coast put up a brave fight against argentina , one of the world cup favorites , and showed more evidence that one day the tournament will have a champion from the african continent .
-lrb- june 11 , 2006 -rrb- live ticker : argentina 6:0 serbia and montenegro reveiw all the details from the match with the dw-world.de live ticker .
feedback what did you think argentina 's chances are of winning the cup ?
